title: 113_hr4496
content: The Act may be cited as the "Covering People With Pre-Existing Conditions Act of 2014" and establishes universal access programs to improve high-risk pools and reinsurance markets for individuals with pre-existing conditions. Each State must operate a qualified State reinsurance program or a qualifying State high-risk pool by January 1, 2015, funded by State premium assessments. States without a current high-risk pool must establish one to meet the requirement. States must operate a qualified State reinsurance program or a qualifying State high-risk pool by January 1, 2015, funded by State premium assessments. If a State is already operating a high-risk pool, it must meet certain criteria to be considered a qualified high-risk pool under the Public Health Service Act. The State may use premium assessment funds to transition from operating a high-risk pool to a qualified State reinsurance program. If the high-risk pool is financially healthy, it meets the requirements. A qualified State reinsurance program provides reinsurance for health insurance in the small group market. A qualified State reinsurance program can provide reinsurance on a prospective or retrospective basis, protecting health insurance issuers against annual aggregate spending and individual catastrophic costs. It must satisfy HIPAA requirements and be deemed a qualified high-risk pool. A qualifying State high-risk pool must offer at least two coverage options, including a high deductible health plan with a health savings account, and be funded stably. The high-risk pool must be funded stably and eliminate waiting lists for eligible residents. It should cover individuals who would be eligible for Medicare after a disability waiting period and limit premiums to 150% of the average standard risk rates. Additionally, the pool must conduct education and outreach programs and provide coverage for preventive services and chronic disease management. Verification of citizenship or nationality is required for participation in a qualifying State high-risk pool receiving funds under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary must ensure that all applicants provide satisfactory documentation in line with the Social Security Act. The Secretary may waive requirements for State reinsurance programs and high-risk pools to accommodate new programs. Funding of $25 billion is appropriated for fiscal years 2015-2024 for Public Health Service Act programs. The terms "health insurance coverage" and "health insurance issuer" are defined in section 2791 of the Public Health Service Act. The term "current section 2745 qualified high risk pool" refers to the qualified high risk pool under section 2745(g) of the Public Health Service Act. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The term "standard risk rate" is a rate determined by considering premium rates, using actuarial techniques, and reflecting anticipated claims experience. The term "State" refers to any of the 50 States or the District of Columbia.
